results.title: Playground Discipline: A Positive Approach (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Playground disruption is a fact of life in the school world, but it can be successfully managed. This film demonstrates how to select and train older students to handle most of the conflicts that occur daily on the playground.

results.title: Hidden treasures
results.creator_credit: David Gill, Kevin Brownlow and Thames Production
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Unknown Chaplin”.
Featuring Charlie Chaplin in previously unseen home movies, scenes from abandoned films and scenes cut from release prints of the classics “City Lights” and “Modern Times”. Narrated by James Mason.

results.title: It is always so in the world
results.creator_credit: Bob Kingsbury, Suzanne Baker and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human Face of China”.
Shanghai in 1979, with its 11 million people, and the second biggest city in the world, was for years dominated by foreign powers. Following the end of the revolution in the early 1970s, China is now caught up in the urgency to accelerate progress and this is expressed by a massive campaign to make everyone personally committed to the aim of the 4 modernisations: to catch up with the west in science, education, agriculture and defence by the year 2000.
results.title_for_label: It is always so in the world
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bob Kingsbury, Suzanne Baker and Film Australia

results.title: The Amazing Bone
results.creator_credit: Michael Sporn, Michael Sporn Animation and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Pearl the pig finds a magic talking bone. On the way home the bone scares off a band of muggers, but does not fair as well with a debonair fox. Although Pearl and the talking bone so live happily ever after.

results.title: Meeting in progress
results.creator_credit: Ian Woolf, Tony Matthews and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Interaction”.
Part 8 of a series of films for managers. Demonstrates two exercises designed to improve managers’ listening and interactive skills. Viewers can participate in the second exercise which involves attempting to follow a set of instructions and shows the problems of communication without feedback. Introduced by Brian Redhead.

results.title: Surviving Parenthood (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Two different groups of parents discuss their feelings and attitudes about coping with children in an honest and unaffected way. Highlights the difficulties couples have adjusting to parenthood and the success or otherwise of “bonding”.
